entities: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia — People’s Army (FARC-EP)
Community of Latin American and Caribbean States (CELAC)
summary:
The Security Council,

Welcoming the Final Agreement for Ending the Conflict and Building a Stable and Long Lasting Peace between the Government of Colombia and the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia — People’s Army (FARC-EP) on 24 August 2016, commends the parties' determination to end over 50 years of conflict.

The Council further welcomes the 23 June 2016 agreements, including the Agreement on the Bilateral and Definitive Ceasefire and Cessation of Hostilities and Laying down of Arms, which provides for a tripartite monitoring and verification mechanism (MVM).

Recalling resolution 2261 (2016), which established a political mission to participate as the international component and coordinator of the MVM for 12 months.

The Council:

1. Welcomes the Secretary-General’s report S/2016/729, approves the recommendations on the size, operational aspects, and mandate of the Mission, including those in paragraph 36.

2. Authorizes the Mission to support preparation and facilities management of Transitional Local Zones for Normalisation and Transitional Local Points for Normalisation, shared equally with the Government of Colombia, during the 12-month period.

3. Welcomes contributions of unarmed observers from Community of Latin American and Caribbean States (CELAC) Member States and other Member States, and looks forward to further contributions.
